channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: Rees Powell will give evidence for an eighth day and is expected to finish going through the 98 critical fibres relating to this trial.
item.title: Claremont killer trial LIVE: ChemCentre fibres expert nearing end of marathon testimony

item.dc:creator: Sherryn Groch
item.description: We hear about a vaccine but what's the other race for a COVID-19 'cure'? What are the most promising treatments? And could a tablet stop you getting infected in the first place?
item.title: Will we get a treatment before a vaccine? Inside the race for a COVID-19 game-changer

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: Britain adopts a tougher stance on China, as UK Defence Secretary Ben Wallace throws his support behind Australia's push to uncover the pandemic's origins.
item.title: Britain backs Morrison's call for probe into coronavirus' China origins

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Corovirus LIVE Queensland updates: Lowest daily tally of new COVID-19 cases in a 24-hour period

item.dc:creator: John Hewson
item.description: Australia cannot afford to become addicted to recurrent debt, but it can use debt wisely to develop a recovery fund that could power our future.
item.title: Let's have good debt, not bad: the key to building our recovery

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Many of Alessandro Diamanti's former clubs - including Atalanta, Brescia, Bologna and Livorno - are based in COVID-19 epicentres.
item.title: 'Follow the rules': Italian A-League star's impassioned plea to Australians

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: An Australian warship has been conducting exercises in the disputed waterway with three US ships in recent days, as anxiety increases about China's expansion in the region while the world is dealing with the coronavirus.
item.title: Marise Payne lashes Beijing's actions in the South China Sea

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Australia records lowest number of COVID-19 cases in 24-hour period since early March, US death toll passes 46,000, Australia's death toll stands at 75

item.dc:creator: Sarah Mitchell
item.description: The NSW Education Minister answers critics of the government's plan for a staged return to school amid the battle against COVID-19.
item.title: Why we've decided on a managed return to school

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Papua New Guinea has recorded its eighth COVID-19 case, sparking concerns about a potential hidden outbreak just as the country looks to ease restrictions.
item.title: Fears for PNG as COVID-19 appears in different parts of the country

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: Pharmacy operator API warns that despite business opportunities, COVID-19 also brought uncertainties as consumers avoid going to shopping centres or browsing in its stores.
item.title: Priceline boss 'not afraid' to close stores if landlords don't budge

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: Media mogul Kerry Stokes and his wife arrived two weeks ago in their private jet and went straight to their riverfront mansion in Perth's billionaire suburb of Dalkeith after being granted an exemption by police.
item.title: Billionaire Kerry Stokes exempted from strict quarantine rules after arriving in Perth from Aspen by private jet

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: Melbourne cop is spearheading a fundraising drive for families of his dead colleagues, as flags fly at half mast and Town Hall prepares turns its lights blue.
item.title: Officer aims to raise $2m for families of four police killed in crash

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: Labour leader Keir Starmer demonstrated the kind of political instinct and emotional intelligence Jeremy Corbyn had zero capacity to achieve.
item.title: Britain has a credible opposition again. And just in time, too

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: The union representing WA’s school teachers will meet the government today to discuss concerns about next week’s return to school.
item.title: WA coronavirus LIVE: WA teachers feel unsafe about school return, survey reveals

item.description: After years of pushing day-to-day management to deputies, the world's richest man has turned back to the here-and-now problems facing the online behemoth as it grapples with a surge of demand and worker unrest brought on by the coronavirus.
item.title: Bezos takes back the wheel to steer Amazon through coronavirus crisis

item.description: Despite less-than-explosive revelations, the announcement means two straight World Series champions were found to have broken the sport's rules during their marches to the title.
item.title: Red Sox escape harsh punishment for sign stealing

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: Health Minister Jenny Mikakos has expressed her condolences to the family of a man who died from the virus on Wednesday and urged anyone with mild symptoms to get tested.
item.title: Man in 60s dies as Victoria records one new coronavirus case

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Scott Morrison wants business and union leaders to come up with new ideas rather than fighting in their corner for their own vested interests.
item.title: Get rid of 'old stale' ideas: Prime Minister wants a new way out of the COVID-19 crisis for Australia

item.description: NSW coach Brad Fittler is angered by what he sees as impatience as the game finds its way through the coronavirus shutdown.
item.title: 'We manage to eat our own in this game': Fittler takes aim at wasteful NRL clubs

item.description: The man in his 60s is one of the state's youngest victims of coronavirus.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Appliance and electronics lender Radio Rentals will permanently shut all retail locations across Australia, marking the first major retail casualty of the coronavirus crisis.
item.title: Radio Rentals shuts down its stores over 'coronavirus-driven downturn'

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: Month-old dashcam footage has surfaced a speeding black Porsche, believed to be the same vehicle involved the deadly Eastern Freeway crash that killed four Victorian police officers.
item.title: 'Like a Formula 1 car went by': Footage emerges of speeding black Porsche

item.description: Fallen former West Coast Eagles captain Ben Cousins has been arrested again in Perth.
item.title: Ben Cousins arrested again in Perth

item.dc:creator: Dominic Bossi
item.description: Football Federation Australia has vowed to finish the 2019-20 A-League season but as yet has no date set.
item.title: A-League to resume only after government approval is given

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: A paramedic and a nurse in Sydney are among five new COVID-19 cases, and a coronavirus cluster at a western Sydney aged care facility has grown by two people.
item.title: Paramedic and nurse among five new coronavirus cases in NSW

item.description: Indie folk-rock band Thao and the Get Down Stay Down have created the first great Zoom video.
item.title: The best music video to emerge from our age of isolation

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: The driver of a black Porsche involved in the deadly Eastern Freeway crash in which four police officers were struck and killed allegedly took photos of the scene before fleeing on foot and then sharing the graphic images with friends.
item.title: Porsche driver took photos of horrific crash scene which killed Victoria Police officers, police allege

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: Mayor Carolyn Goodman had offered her city up as an experimental "control group" to determine whether physical distancing stops the spread of the coronavirus.
item.title: Las Vegas mayor calls for re-opening of casinos as 'control group'

item.dc:creator: David Scutt
item.description: ASX enjoys strong start to the session following sharp rebound on Wall Street.
item.title: Miners, tech propel ASX higher in early trade

item.description: Tiger Woods and Phil Mickelson are ready for a made-for-TV rematch at a time when fans are craving live action. And this time, they'll have company.
item.title: Woods, Mickelson to stage celebrity match in May

item.description: Timothy Springer thought his fortune was excessive, even before reaping a 17,000 return on his investment in a small biotech firm that's now working on a vaccine to protect against the coronavirus.
item.title: Harvard professor's bet pays off in COVID crisis, making him a billionaire

item.description: In one of the best Anzac Day contests staged, Collingwood enhanced their claims as premiership contenders while Essendon did nothing to disturb the idea they, too, will be there at the end.
item.title: From the Archives, 2019: Pies hold off Dons in Anzac Day thriller

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: The man was armed with an axe during a six-hour siege on Wednesday before police went into the unit and found it empty.
item.title: Man remains missing after slipping through Gold Coast siege police net

item.description: The Australian sharemarket is expected to open higher this morning, thanks to a rally on Wall Street overnight after world oil prices rose.
item.title: 8@eight: Wall Street relief rally over oil price set to buoy ASX

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: The meeting was set as one of the most respected Wallabies captains withdrew his support for the captains' letter which called for the RA administration to stand aside.
item.title: Castle to open books for Super Rugby chairs as Lynagh baulks at captains' letter

item.description: Questions about Kim's health flared after he skipped an April 15 commemoration of the 108th birthday of his grandfather, North Korea founder Kim Il-sung.
item.title: North Korean silence on Kim Jong-un's health raises succession speculation

item.dc:creator: David Prestipino
item.description: The AFL has held talks with WA government officials about the state hosting clubs in a quarantine hub when football players return to club training in coming weeks ahead of a planned mid-year resumption to season 2020.
item.title: 'Great for morale': WA Premier open to WA as an AFL hub as high-level talks progress

item.description: The Aces regard Liz Cambage as 'one of the marquee players in the world' and she is looking forward to returning to Las Vegas.
item.title: Cambage agrees to new Las Vegas Aces contract

item.description: King Gizzard and The Lizard Wizard made a tour documentary - then cinemas closed. So they're putting it out online instead, for a limited time.
item.title: 'Play it loud': King Gizzard rockumentary goes online for fans

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: The mother of the victim, Nicholas Braid, described him as "charismatic, stunning, stylish, witty and irreverent".
item.title: Woman charged with murder after former law student stabbed on Gold Coast street

item.dc:creator: John Silvester
item.description: Two constables and two senior constables, along with hundreds of other police, got up and got dressed to go to work. They didn’t go home at the end of their shift.
item.title: A new recruit, quiet and respected, among police killed in freeway crash

item.description: A German retail association said the mood among shoppers remained very subdued due to concerns about jobs and finances.
item.title: 'No lines, no crowds' and little shopping: Germans stay home as stores reopen

item.description: The coronavirus pandemic and the economic turmoil it creates will likely spur the largest single loss in insurance industry history, said the head of the international insurance giant.
item.title: Coronavirus will be 'largest event in insurance history', Chubb says

item.description: It's a view backed by the founder of the WTA Tour, Billie Jean King, who says unity has long been her goal.
item.title: 'It should have happened a long time ago': Federer wants men's and women's tennis united

item.description: The doctor said he was removed from his post after he pressed for a rigorous vetting of a coronavirus treatment embraced by Trump.
item.title: Doctor says he was sacked from federal post after questioning hydroxychloroquine treatment

item.description: Brent crude oil rebounded from two days of losses and US futures surged on Wednesday, bolstered by tentative talk of additional supply cuts from OPEC producers and a tweet by Donald Trump.
item.title: Brent crude rebounds from 20-year low; US oil up 20 per cent in wild trade

item.description: Democratic Governor Tony Evers tried to delay the April 7 election or move all voting to mail-in ballots but courts ruled in-person voting should go ahead.
item.title: Coronavirus cases linked to Wisconsin's April primary

item.description: Stocks around the world were clawing higher on Wednesday, and Wall Street's S&P 500 benchmark index climbed toward its first gain in what's been a dismal week for markets.
item.title: Stocks claw higher worldwide as oil bounces back

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: "Something is going wrong. There is a pattern emerging. We were slow into lockdown, slow on testing, slow on protective equipment."
item.title: Britain insists it can make up virus testing shortfall despite lagging pace
